TEXT: The applicant , “ ORG - STRO ” ORG , is a company incorporated in GPE .
On DATE the applicant company ( the applicant ) bought goods , which were valued at CARDINAL NORP lei ( MDL ) ( the equivalent of MONEY ( ORG ) at the time ) , from a NORP company .
On DATE the applicant ’s merchandise crossed the NORP border . On DATE the applicant registered a customs declaration at ORG .

On DATE ORG fined the applicant for failure to declare the imported goods within the legal time limit of TIME from the moment of crossing the border . The fine was imposed in accordance with the provisions of LAW ( see “ LAW ” below ) and represented PERCENT from the total value of the goods and was set at an amount of ORG ( the equivalent of ORG CARDINAL,CARDINAL.CARDINAL at the time ) .

The applicant ’s representative was also fined for failure to present relevant documents for the imported goods within the same legal time limit . The fine was imposed in accordance with the provisions of LAW and was set at an amount of MDL CARDINAL ( the equivalent of EUR CARDINAL at the time ) .
On DATE the applicant brought an action against ORG , seeking the annulment of the decision in respect of the fine imposed on it .
On DATE the ORG ruled in favour of the applicant and annulled ORG decision in respect of the applicant . The latter lodged an appeal against the judgment .

On DATE ORG upheld the appeal lodged by ORG and dismissed the applicant ’s action . During the proceedings , the applicant ’s representative admitted its failure to observe the legal time limit for lodging the customs declaration and gave reasons for the failure , but ORG considered those reasons as irrelevant .
The relevant provisions of LAW DATE read as follows :
“ Article CARDINAL . ORG declaration filing deadlines
CARDINAL . ORG declaration shall be filed within TIME following the crossing of the customs frontier . ( ... )
Article CARDINAL . Types of Customs Regulations infringements which entail material liability
The following LAW infringements shall entail material liability :

CARDINAL ) a failure to declare goods crossing the customs frontier according to the established procedure , or a false declaration , in the absence of elements constituting smuggling or other crimes ; ( ... )
Article CARDINAL . Penalties for ORG offences which entail material liability
Legal entities and entities engaged in business activities without being incorporated as legal entities when committing offences specified in :

a ) Article CARDINAL(CARDINAL)-(CARDINAL ) , shall be subject to a fine in an amount equivalent to PERCENT of the value of goods which constitute the object of the offence with or without licence revocation ; ”
